- Removing min and max character length for description and other Hackathon form fields because they are not necessary any more

- Adding some error logging
- Adding a message when there are no teams distributed yet on the "Assign Mentor" page

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,46 @@ +{% load hackadmin_tags %} + + + + + + + + + + + + + {% if participants %} + {% for participant in participants %} + + + + + +
Slack Display NameEmailCurrent LMS ModulePrivilegesActions
+ {{ participant.slack_display_name }} + + {{ participant.email }} + + {{ participant.current_lms_module|readable_lms_module|title }} + + {{participant.user_type|readable_user_type}} + + + {% if slack_url and not participant.is_external %} + {% split_string string=participant.username delimiter="_" index=0 as slack_username %}
comment.body:
Same as before.
The `username` is different to the `slack_display_name`. The `username` is the user's ID and Workspace ID separated by an underscore. Using the split I am retrieving just the user's ID to generate a link to the user's Slack profile.

Cool template trick - didn't know about `{% split_string %}`...
However... why are we removing things like **_ci**, **_alumni**, **_mentor**, **_lead**, etc?
If we want to display the Slack username/display name, shouldn't it be "exact" to make it easier to find someone, in case of duplicates or similar names?

review.body:
A few things mentioned below.... suggestions / possible improvements, etc.

I started mentioning the code-blocks like these:
`{% if request.user.user_type|is_types:"SUPERUSER,STAFF,FACILITATOR_ADMIN,FACILITATOR_JUDGE,PARTNER_ADMIN,PARTNER_JUDGE" %}`

But the more I got into viewing the other files, the more I saw this was re-used in multiple places.
Would it not be better to define set groups for varied permissions, elsewhere?

If group A can do FOO, and group B can do BAR, why are we setting these within the different if-statements. Why not use something like a {% with %} block to set the varied groups apart, and just re-use the new "with-variable" being set.

`{% with group_A="FOO1, FOO2, FOO3, etc" %}{% endwith %}`
`{% with group_B="BAR1, BAR2, BAR3,etc" %}{% endwith %}`

Then these can be re-used as such:
`{% if user_type in group_A %}`
for example.... just a thought to clean it up a bit, but not necessary.

Apart from those suggestions, feel free to accept this as **LGTM**, and let me know, I'll adjust from Review-Comment to Approved

pull_request.title: #A19. As Admin, I would like to change which hackathons are included in the showcase and be able to select a specific order
pull_request.body:
## Description
Adding a Singleton (only one entry ever) showcase settings model which can be used to retrieve the following settings for the showcase page:
- Which Hackathons should be included in the list of projects
- Which Hackathons should be included in the featured showcases
- How many projects should be in featured showcases
- How many projects per page should be displayed

## Pull request type
- [ ] #M01 (Miscellaneous User Story #01)

- [ ] Refactoring
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] Other (please describe):

## Related Issue
#181

## Configuration instructions
Need to create a new "ShowcaseSiteSettings" model instance when deploying or seed it from the fixtures.

## Testing
All tests (apart from Custom Slack Provider) passing as normal.

## Additional Information
[More info on Singleton pattern](https://refactoring.guru/design-patterns/singleton)

## Does this introduce a breaking change
- [x] Yes
- [] No
If no hackathons selected, there will be no showcases displayed.

pull_request.title: Bump pygments from 2.7.3 to 2.7.4
pull_request.body:
Bumps [pygments](https://github.com/pygments/pygments) from 2.7.3 to 2.7.4.
Release notes

Sourced from pygments's releases.

2.7.4

  • Updated lexers:

    • Apache configurations: Improve handling of malformed tags (#1656)

    • CSS: Add support for variables (#1633, #1666)

    • Crystal (#1650, #1670)

    • Coq (#1648)

    • Fortran: Add missing keywords (#1635, #1665)

    • Ini (#1624)

    • JavaScript and variants (#1647 -- missing regex flags, #1651)

    • Markdown (#1623, #1617)

    • Shell

      • Lex trailing whitespace as part of the prompt (#1645)
      • Add missing in keyword (#1652)

    • SQL - Fix keywords (#1668)

    • Typescript: Fix incorrect punctuation handling (#1510, #1511)

  • Fix infinite loop in SML lexer (#1625)

  • Fix backtracking string regexes in JavaScript/TypeScript, Modula2 and many other lexers (#1637)

  • Limit recursion with nesting Ruby heredocs (#1638)

  • Fix a few inefficient regexes for guessing lexers

  • Fix the raw token lexer handling of Unicode (#1616)

  • Revert a private API change in the HTML formatter (#1655) -- please note that private APIs remain subject to change!

  • Fix several exponential/cubic-complexity regexes found by Ben Caller/Doyensec (#1675)

  • Fix incorrect MATLAB example (#1582)

Thanks to Google's OSS-Fuzz project for finding many of these bugs.
